info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 4:34PM EDT until June 16 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Harrison County in east central Ohio... Northeastern Guernsey County in east central Ohio... Western Belmont County in east central Ohio... Southern Tuscarawas County in east central Ohio... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 433 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Newcomerstown, or 9 miles southwest of Uhrichsville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Uhrichsville, Barnesville, Cadiz, Freeport, Newcomerstown, Dennison, Gnadenhutten, Bethesda, Antrim, Tuscarawas, Flushing, and Adena. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
